intro: Pellaea lomariacea var. digitatopalmata, commonly known as the palmate fern, is a perennial plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, palmately divided fronds. The fronds are typically bi- or tri-pinnate, giving the plant a lush, feathery appearance. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. The plant's rhizomes are fibrous and help anchor it to rocky or soil substrates.
